questions.question: Which of the following gates is known as a universal gate?

explanations.a: AND gate is not a universal gate.
explanations.b: OR gate cannot construct all logic functions.
explanations.c: NAND gate is a universal gate. Learn more
explanations.d: XOR is not a universal gate.

questions.question: What does SOP stand for in Boolean algebra?

explanations.c: Correct. SOP means Sum of Products.
explanations.d: Not a valid term in Boolean logic.

questions.question: The POS form of a Boolean expression is a product of:

explanations.a: SOP is Sum of Products, not POS.
explanations.c: Difference is not a Boolean term.

questions.question: Which of the following expressions represents an AND gate?

questions.question: Which logic gate produces a HIGH output only when both inputs are LOW?

explanations.a: AND outputs HIGH only when both inputs are HIGH.
explanations.b: OR outputs HIGH if at least one input is HIGH.
explanations.c: Correct. NOR is the inverse of OR.
explanations.d: XOR outputs HIGH when inputs differ.
